member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim
member.summary: Applies a list of s to an Avalon .

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.OptionDevTenBeta2PlantIntoStatusDockPanel
member.summary: In DevTen Beta2, the status bar itself lives on another thread, which makes it planting our controls very complicated because of the threading issues. That's why we prefer planting to the dock panel that hosts the status bar.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AvalonStatusBar
member.summary: When non-Null, means the status bar we should be attached to. Note: this is used along the code path when we have the status bar hosted on the UI thread (VS10 beta 1). In VS 10 Beta 2, another approach is used. This code remains for possible other shells.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.StatusDockPanel
member.summary: When non-Null, means the on the bottom of the window, to which our status indicators should be added in a dock-right fashion. Usually the status bar itself sits in the same dock panel. This approach is used when we cannot deal with the status bar itself to put the items into it properly. The case in VS 10 beta 2, where the status bar control itself sits on another thread and causes a marshalling pain for us if operated directly. It's expected to be a really, but we'd fallback for cases when we find ourselves in an unexpected layout and look for just any suitable panel.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Tries to find an Avalon status bar in the given window. The window must be fully inited by the moment.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusDockPanelInHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Tries to detect the status line of the window

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AddItemsHostToStatusBar(JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime,System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Helper for attaching to a status bar. Places a panel for our items in among its indicators. Must be executed on the status bar thread.
member.param: The status bar to plant into.
The Avalon element to put on the status bar as its item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AddItemsHostToStatusDockPanel(JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime,System.Windows.Controls.Panel,System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Helper for attaching to the status line of a window. Places a panel for our items in between the status bar and resize grip. Must be executed on the UI thread.
member.param: The dock panel of the window status line.
The Avalon element to put on the status bar as its item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd_UiThread(System.Windows.PresentationSource)
member.summary: Take 1: find all explicit status bars in the application window. Workable on VS10 up to Beta2 (non-inclusive).

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd_WorkerThread(System.Windows.PresentationSource)
member.summary: Take 2: in VS 10 beta 2, the status bar is hosted in another thread. There seems to be no legal way for ripping out the nested object graph. Do some hacks.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.DataContext.FindAvalonDataProviders.FindDataProvidersInElement(System.Windows.IInputElement)
member.summary: Queries elements for context by bubbling an event.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.DataContext.GetDataProvidersEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments to the routed event.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.DataContext.GetDataProvidersEventArgs.GetDataProvidersEvent
member.summary: Fires when the a Data Context is about to be created and looks for s on Avalon UI elements to query for data. This event will fire when you call interface members on , or the method and its siblings. When you sink the event, add your data providers to the list ( with manually assigned constants and data rules in the most common case). Do not set to True so that the event could bubble up and collect all of the data providers in the UI tree. Add your data providers to the end, which will make sure the deepest controls take precedence with their most concrete data.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.DataContext.GetDataProvidersEventArgs.DataProviders
member.summary: Add your data providers to the end of this collection. See documentation for details.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.DataContext.GetDataProvidersEventArgs.GetDataProvidersEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type for the routed event.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.HwndSourceEx

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.HwndSourceEx.GetElementBoundsInWindowPixels(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: For an UI Element hosted in an HWND render target, gets its pixel bounds within the HWND. The pixels are window-relative, but nonclient (ie are based on the window bounds not on the client area).

member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.
